bits.name: senConn
bits.description: Sensor is connected to I2C interface

bits.name: sclPin
bits.description: PIO number of the I2C SCL line

bits.name: sdaPin
bits.description: PIO number of the I2C SDA line

issues: Incorrect bitfield definition for 'pioConf' (renamed to 'pins' in canonical). The extraction interprets pin selectors as 1-bit flags (bits 0-0 and 1-1) rather than multi-bit integer fields specifying the PIO number.
SDA Pin field offset is likely incorrect in extraction (typically starts at bit 8 for u-blox X2 pin masks, not bit 1).

adjudication.reasoning: The extraction identifies the message structure correctly in terms of byte layout (length 6) and top-level fields. However, the interpretation of the 'pioConf' (or 'pins') field is technically incorrect. In u-blox protocols, PIO selection fields are integers representing the pin number (requiring 4-6 bits) rather than single boolean flags. Additionally, the SDA pin selection usually resides in the upper byte (starting at bit 8) of the X2 word, whereas the extraction placed it at bit 1.
